intro: Astragalus lagopus, commonly known as the snow lotus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas, Central Asia, and the Tibetan Plateau. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, yellow or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. Due to its habitat and appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
